result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Whitney R Roberson.  Attorney Jennifer L Pickett in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties. State requested to adjourn the jury trial date. Court to address other acts motion on a future court date. Court vacated the jury trial date and adjourned matter to tag along with pending matter 19CF2602 to determine it's posture after it resolve. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Received and Filed: State's Response to Defense's Objection to Introduce Other Acts Evidence

Defendant Whitney R Roberson appeared by video.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs appeared by video for Whitney R Roberson.  Attorney Jennifer L Pickett in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Jennifer Pickett.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense filed a request for substitution of Judge.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11.  Court vacates final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-10-2022
Received and Filed: Judge Crivello

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are requesting adjourned final pretrial and trial dates. Case is adjourned.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court via zoom, with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Motion Hearing. State request an adjournment of Jury Trial due to reasons presented to the Court. Case passed, in chambers discussion held. Case recalled. Court will leave case on for Final Pretrial on July 21, 2022 at 8:15 am, Branch 38.
filed.
Defendant's Objection to Other Acts Evidence; filed.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Final Pretrial. Case remains in a jury trial posture. State has filed an Other Acts Motion to which defense request time to reply. Defense response due in one week. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
filed.
Other Acts Motion; filed.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 4 SUPERVISION.  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 12:00 P.M. ON 4-20-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sarah M., David B., Tiffany H., and Tiffany Y.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Initial Appearance.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DID IT OFF THE RECORD.
Attorney Opland Dobs notified the court that his client tested positive for COVID. He does have the paperwork. Court date for today has been vacated. Case rescheduled.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22 @ 2:30p
State asks that warrant be withdrawn.  Issued in error.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn. State will mail summons.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
